str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
From philos and hippos; fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
